alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:43AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND HIGH WAVES EXPECTED WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY... A strong low will bring impactful weather to Southwest Alaska, primarily for Bristol Bay, from Wednesday evening through Friday. Gusts of 35-45 mph are likely, with gusts as high as 60 mph possible from Kamishak Bay into interior Bristol Bay. Waves up to 10-15 ft are possible over Bristol Bay which could result in high surf along the coast. A lesser but non-zero threat for high surf also exists along the Kuskokwim Delta Thursday afternoon as flow shifts through a brief favorable period. However, with the low tracking further east than previously forecast, latest guidance suggest that wave heights offshore of the Kuskokwim Delta will struggle to build to more than 8 feet. Thus, concerns for the Kuskokwim Delta are lessening. Please monitor weather.gov/afc as we continue to update the forecast.
